In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

فَقُلْتُ اسْتَغْفِرُوْا رَبَّكُمْ ؕ اِنَّهٗ كَانَ غَفَّارًاۙ۝۱۰ یُّرْسِلِ السَّمَآءَ عَلَیْكُمْ مِّدْرَارًاۙ۝۱۱ وَّ یُمْدِدْكُمْ بِاَمْوَالٍ وَّ بَنِیْنَ وَ یَجْعَلْ لَّكُمْ جَنّٰتٍ وَّ یَجْعَلْ لَّكُمْ اَنْهٰرًاؕ۝۱۲ مَا لَكُمْ لَا تَرْجُوْنَ لِلّٰهِ وَقَارًاۚ۝۱۳

I said: Seek forgiveness from your Lord. Indeed, He is Most Forgiving. He will send abundant rain upon you from the sky, increase you in wealth and children, and provide for you gardens and rivers. What is the matter with you that you do not fear the majesty of Allah at all?

Surah Nuh, Verses 10-13

Narrated Abu Huraira (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الصِّيَامُ جُنَّةٌ فَلاَ يَرْفُثْ ، وَلاَ يَجْهَلْ وَإِنِ امْرُؤٌ قَاتَلَهُ ، أَوْ شَاتَمَهُ فَلْيَقُلْ إِنِّي صَائِمٌ مَرَّتَيْنِ وَالَّذِي نَفْسِي بِيَدِهِ لَخُلُوفُ فَمِ الصَّائِمِ أَطْيَبُ عِنْدَ اللهِ تَعَالَى مِنْ رِيحِ الْمِسْكِ يَتْرُكُ طَعَامَهُ وَشَرَابَهُ وَشَهْوَتَهُ مِنْ أَجْلِي الصِّيَامُ لِي وَأَنَا أَجْزِي بِهِ وَالْحَسَنَةُ بِعَشْرِ أَمْثَالِهَا

Fasting is a shield. Therefore, do not engage in obscenity and do not act ignorantly. If someone tries to quarrel with him or insults him, he should reply twice, I am fasting. By the One in Whose Hand is my soul, the smell that comes from the mouth of a fasting person is more pleasant to Allah than the fragrance of musk. (Allah says about the fasting person), 'He has left his food, drink, and desires for My sake. The fast is for Me. So I will reward (the fasting person) for it, and the reward of good deeds is multiplied ten times.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1894 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 1783 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰبُنَیَّ اَقِمِ الصَّلٰوةَ وَ اْمُرْ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ وَ انْهَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ اصْبِرْ عَلٰی مَاۤ اَصَابَكَ ؕ اِنَّ ذٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ الْاُمُوْرِۚ

(Luqman [AS] said to his son) O my son! Establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, that is the matter of great resolve.

Surah Luqman, Verse 17

Footnote:

Establishing Salat means being diligent in performing prayers with the congregation on time, observing all the rules.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

اِنَّ الْمُسْلِمِیْنَ وَ الْمُسْلِمٰتِ وَ الْمُؤْمِنِیْنَ وَ الْمُؤْمِنٰتِ وَ الْقٰنِتِیْنَ وَ الْقٰنِتٰتِ وَ الصّٰدِقِیْنَ وَ الصّٰدِقٰتِ وَ الصّٰبِرِیْنَ وَ الصّٰبِرٰتِ وَ الْخٰشِعِیْنَ وَ الْخٰشِعٰتِ وَ الْمُتَصَدِّقِیْنَ وَ الْمُتَصَدِّقٰتِ وَ الصَّآىِٕمِیْنَ وَ الصّٰٓىِٕمٰتِ وَ الْحٰفِظِیْنَ فُرُوْجَهُمْ وَ الْحٰفِظٰتِ وَ الذّٰكِرِیْنَ اللّٰهَ كَثِیْرًا وَّ الذّٰكِرٰتِ ۙ اَعَدَّ اللّٰهُ لَهُمْ مَّغْفِرَةً وَّ اَجْرًا عَظِیْمًا

Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the devoutly obedient men and the devoutly obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard it, and the men who remember Allah often and the women who do so. Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward for them all.

Surah Al-Ahzab, Verse 35

Narrated by Uthman ibn Affan (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ قَالَ بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِى لاَ يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَىْءٌ فِى الأَرْضِ وَلاَ فِى السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ لَمْ تُصِبْهُ فَجْأَةُ بَلاَءٍ حَتَّى يُصْبِحَ وَمَنْ قَالَهَا حِينَ يُصْبِحُ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ لَمْ تُصِبْهُ فَجْأَةُ بَلاَءٍ حَتَّى يُمْسِىَ

Whoever recites this supplication three times in the morning will not be afflicted by any sudden calamity until evening. And whoever recites it in the evening will not be afflicted by any sudden calamity until morning. بِسْمِ اللهِ الَّذِىْ لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهٖ شَىْءٌ فِى الْاَرْضِ وَلَا فِى السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيْعُ الْعَلِيْمُ (Meaning: I (begin the day) in the name of Allah, with whose name nothing on earth or in the heavens can cause harm. And He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.) One of the narrators of this hadith was paralyzed. The person to whom he was narrating the hadith looked at him with astonishment. He then said: Are you surprised to see me? By Allah, I have not lied. On the day I was afflicted with this calamity, I had forgotten to recite the supplication.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 5088

Narrated by Sumama Ibn Abdullah (RA), he said,

كَانَ أَنَسٌ يَتَنَفَّسُ فِي الإِنَاءِ مَرَّتَيْنِ ، أَوْ ثَلاَثًا وَزَعَمَ أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ يَتَنَفَّسُ ثَلاَثًا

It was the practice of Anas (RA) to drink water from a vessel in two or three breaths. He believed that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to drink water in three breaths.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5229
(Islamic Foundation Bangladesh) 5631 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baki)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

أَرَأَيْتُمْ لَوْ أَنَّ نَهَرًا بِبَابِ أَحَدِكُمْ يَغْتَسِلُ فِيهِ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ خَمْسًا مَا تَقُولُ ذَلِكَ يُبْقِي مِنْ دَرَنِهِ ؟ قَالُوا : لاَ يُبْقِي مِنْ دَرَنِهِ شَيْئًا قَالَ فَذَلِكَ مِثْلُ الصَّلَوَاتِ الْخَمْسِ يَمْحُو اللَّهُ بِهَا الْخَطَايَا.

Tell me, if there was a river in front of one of your house, and he bathed in it five times a day, would there be any dirt left on him? They said, no dirt would be left on him. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: That is the example of the five daily prayers. Through them, Allah erases the sins (of a servant).

Sahih al-Bukhari, 528 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 503 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا قُوْۤا اَنْفُسَكُمْ وَ اَهْلِیْكُمْ نَارًا وَّ قُوْدُهَا النَّاسُ وَ الْحِجَارَةُ عَلَیْهَا مَلٰٓىِٕكَةٌ غِلَاظٌ شِدَادٌ لَّا یَعْصُوْنَ اللّٰهَ مَاۤ اَمَرَهُمْ وَ یَفْعَلُوْنَ مَا یُؤْمَرُوْنَ

O you who have believed, protect yourselves and your families from a fire whose fuel is people and stones. Appointed over it are angels who are stern and severe of heart. They do not disobey Allah in what He commands them and do what they are commanded.

Surah At-Tahrim, Verse 6

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ لَمْ يَدَعْ قَوْلَ الزُّورِ وَالْعَمَلَ بِهِ فَلَيْسَ لِلَّهِ حَاجَةٌ فِي أَنْ يَدَعَ طَعَامَهُ وَشَرَابَهُ

Whoever does not give up false speech and acting upon it and ignorance, Allah has no need of his giving up his food and drink (in the name of fasting).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1903 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5631 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Abdullah Bbn ‘Umar (RA): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said:

صَلاَةُ الْجَمَاعَةِ تَفْضُلُ صَلاَةَ الْفَذِّ بِسَبْعٍ وَعِشْرِينَ دَرَجَةً

The reward of prayer in a congregation is twenty-seven times greater than that of a prayer offered alone.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 645 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 617 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

This reward is for men. And for women, it is better to pray in their own homes. This is what is stated in the authentic hadith.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

فَبِظُلْمٍ مِّنَ الَّذِیْنَ هَادُوْا حَرَّمْنَا عَلَیْهِمْ طَیِّبٰتٍ اُحِلَّتْ لَهُمْ وَ بِصَدِّهِمْ عَنْ سَبِیْلِ اللّٰهِ كَثِیْرًاۙ۝۱۶۰ وَّ اَخْذِهِمُ الرِّبٰوا وَ قَدْ نُهُوْا عَنْهُ وَ اَكْلِهِمْ اَمْوَالَ النَّاسِ بِالْبَاطِلِ ؕ وَ اَعْتَدْنَا لِلْكٰفِرِیْنَ مِنْهُمْ عَذَابًا اَلِیْمًا۝۱۶۱

For the great transgression of the Jews, I forbade them some excellent things which were (previously) made lawful for them, and for their excessive obstruction of the way of Allah, and for their taking of usury, though they were forbidden to take it. And for their wrongful consumption of people’s wealth. For those among them who are disbelievers, I have prepared a painful punishment.

Surah An-Nisa, Verses 160, 161

Footnote:

The Jews used to transgress greatly in matters of religion. In addition to that, they used to prevent others from following the path of Allah. They used to take usury. They used to devour people's wealth unjustly. As a punishment for these injustices, some excellent foods were made forbidden for them. It is noteworthy that the injustices for which they suffered that punishment in the world are also unjust and forbidden in our Sharia. We must also stay away from such injustices. Otherwise, we will face severe punishment in the hereafter.

Narrated by Miqdam Ibn Ma'dikarib (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَا مَلأَ آدَمِيٌّ وِعَاءً شَرًّا مِنْ بَطْنٍ. بِحَسْبِ ابْنِ آدَمَ أُكْلاَتٌ يُقِمْنَ صُلْبَهُ ، فَإِنْ كَانَ لاَ مَحَالَةَ فَثُلُثٌ لِطَعَامِهِ وَثُلُثٌ لِشَرَابِهِ وَثُلُثٌ لِنَفَسِهِ

No vessel is filled by a human being worse than the stomach. For the son of Adam, a few mouthfuls are enough to keep him standing upright. But if he must eat more, then let one-third be for food, one-third for water, and one-third for breath.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2380 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 2383 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Musa Ash'ari (RA), he said, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

أَيُّمَا رَجُلٍ كَانَتْ لَهُ جَارِيَةٌ فَأَدَّبَهَا فَأَحْسَنَ تَأْدِيبَهَا وَأَعْتَقَهَا وَتَزَوَّجَهَا فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ وَأَيُّمَا عَبْدٍ أَدَّى حَقَّ اللهِ وَحَقَّ مَوَالِيهِ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ.

Whoever teaches his slave girl knowledge and manners well, and then frees her and marries her, will have two rewards. And any slave who fulfills the right of Allah and the right of his masters will also have two rewards.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2547 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2379 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الْمُدَّثِّرُۙ۝۱ قُمْ فَاَنْذِرْ۪ۙ۝۲ وَ رَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرْ۪ۙ۝۳ وَ ثِیَابَكَ فَطَهِّرْ۪ۙ۝۴ وَ الرُّجْزَ فَاهْجُرْ۪ۙ۝۵ وَ لَا تَمْنُنْ تَسْتَكْثِرُ۪ۙ۝۶ وَ لِرَبِّكَ فَاصْبِرْؕ۝۷

O you who are covered! Arise and warn the people. And glorify your Lord (proclaim His greatness). And keep your garments pure. And stay away from impurity. And do not show kindness expecting to receive more in return. And be patient for the sake of your Lord.

Surah Al-Muddaththir, Verses 1-7

Footnote:

Giving a gift to someone with the intention that they will give more in return is not permissible in the light of this verse.

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِحُسْنِ صَحَابَتِي قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ أُمُّكَ قَالَ ثُمَّ مَنْ قَالَ ثُمَّ أَبُوكَ

A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and asked: O Messenger of Allah! Who is most deserving of receiving the best treatment from me?? He said: Your mother. The man said: Then who? The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: Your mother. He said: Then who? He said, Your mother. He said: Then who? He said: Then your father.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5971 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5546 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

مَنْ رَأَى مُنْكَرًا فَاسْتَطَاعَ أَنْ يُغَيِّرَهُ بِيَدِهِ فَلْيُغَيِّرْهُ بِيَدِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَبِلِسَانِهِ فَإِنْ لَمْ يَسْتَطِعْ فَبِقَلْبِهِ وَذَلِكَ أَضْعَفُ الإِيمَانِ

If any of you see something that is against the Sharia, you should stop it with your hand (force) if possible. If you cannot stop it with your hand, then you should speak out against it. If you cannot even do that, then you should consider it wrong in your heart. And that is the weakest form of faith.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 1140 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى النَّبِىِّ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَا لَقِيتُ مِنْ عَقْرَبٍ لَدَغَتْنِى الْبَارِحَةَ قَالَ « أَمَا لَوْ قُلْتَ حِينَ أَمْسَيْتَ أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ لَمْ تَضُرُّكَ »

A companion said to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), 'Last night a scorpion stung me, the like of which I have never seen.' The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) mentioned this supplication and said: If you had recited it in the evening, it would not have harmed you- اَعُوْذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللهِ التَّآمَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ (Meaning: I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from all the harm of His creation.) The supplication can also be recited in the morning.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2709 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6633 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

مَا أَسْفَلَ مِنَ الْكَعْبَيْنِ مِنَ الإِزَارِ فَفِي النَّار

Whatever part of the lower garment is below the ankles will be in Hell.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5787 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5371 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Izar means loincloth. However, the prohibition in this hadith includes all types of clothing. No clothing, such as lungi, pants, pajamas, jubba, etc., should be worn hanging below the ankles.

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said:

مَنْ أَخَذَ أَمْوَالَ النَّاسِ يُرِيدُ أَدَاءَهَا أَدَّى اللَّهُ عَنْهُ ، وَمَنْ أَخَذَ يُرِيدُ إِتْلاَفَهَا أَتْلَفَهُ اللَّهُ

Whoever takes people’s wealth (as a loan) intending to repay it, Allah will enable him to repay it. And whoever takes it intending to squander it, Allah will destroy him.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 2387 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 2229 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

الإِيمَانُ بِضْعٌ وَسِتُّونَ شُعْبَةً وَالْحَيَاءُ شُعْبَةٌ مِنَ الإِيمَانِ

Faith has over sixty branches. And modesty is a branch of faith.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 9 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 8 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ اَنْكِحُوا الْاَیَامٰی مِنْكُمْ وَ الصّٰلِحِیْنَ مِنْ عِبَادِكُمْ وَ اِمَآىِٕكُمْ ؕ اِنْ یَّكُوْنُوْا فُقَرَآءَ یُغْنِهِمُ اللّٰهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهٖ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِیْمٌ۝۳۲

Marry the unmarried among you (whether they are men or women), and also those who are suitable for marriage among your male and female slaves. If they are in need, Allah will enrich them out of His grace. Allah is All-Sufficient, All-Knowing.

Surah An-Nur, Verse 32 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Narrated by Amr Ibn 'As (RA), he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say,

إِذَا حَكَمَ الْحَاكِمُ فَاجْتَهَدَ ثمَّ أَصَابَ فَلَهُ أَجْرَانِ ، وَإِذَا حَكَمَ فَاجْتَهَدَ ثُمَّ أَخْطَأَ فَلَهُ أَجْرٌ

If a judge makes a correct decision through ijtihad, he will have two rewards. And if a judge makes a mistake in ijtihad, he will still have one reward.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6850 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh) 7352 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Footnote:

This ijtihad may pertain to issuing fatwas on religious matters, or to adjudicating worldly affairs in a court governed by Islamic Shariah. However, in whichever matter it is undertaken, the one performing ijtihad must first be qualified and suitable to do so.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

Surah An-Nisa, Verse 19 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

In the era of ignorance, it was customary that the heirs of a deceased man would assume ownership of his wife just as they inherited his other property. One of them might marry her without giving her a mahr, or marry her off elsewhere and take the mahr for himself. The first part of this verse prohibited such practices, declaring that when a husband dies, his wife is free. She may marry whomever she wishes following the laws of Shariah, and none of the deceased man’s heirs has any right to impose anything upon her. The second part of the verse states that if a man does not wish to live with his wife, he must not coerce her into seeking khul‘ (divorce initiated by the wife) to reclaim the mahr he had given her. In other words, he's not maintaining a regular marital life with his wife, but he's also not granting her a divorce, hoping instead that she will seek khul‘ so he can recover the mahr or be excused from paying what he owes. This verse forbids forcing the wife into khul‘ for such reasons. However, if the wife is openly involved in immoral behavior and the husband does not wish to continue the marriage for that reason, then the matter is different.

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 2418 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Narrated by Jabir (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَيْنَ الْعَبْدِ وَبَيْنَ الْكُفْرِ تَرْكُ الصَّلاَةِ

The difference between a believer and disbelief is abandoning prayer.

Sunan Abu Dawood, Hadith 4678

Footnote:

Intentionally abandoning prayer cannot be the act of a Muslim. Abandoning prayer is the act of a disbeliever. If someone intentionally abandons a prayer, it is as if he has erased this distinction between a believer and a disbeliever. However, if someone abandons prayer while still considering it a sin, he will not become a disbeliever because of this crime. He will be a fasiq (transgressor). But if someone does not consider abandoning prayer a sin at all, then he will become a disbeliever.

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), from the Prophet (peace be upon him). He said,

إِذَا سَمِعْتُمُ الإِقَامَةَ فَامْشُوا إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ وَعَلَيْكُمْ بِالسَّكِينَةِ وَالْوَقَارِ ، وَلاَ تُسْرِعُوا فَمَا أَدْرَكْتُمْ فَصَلُّوا وَمَا فَاتَكُمْ فَأَتِمُّوا

When you hear the Iqamah, proceed to the prayer. You should maintain calmness and dignity. Do not rush. Whatever you catch up with the imam, pray it, and whatever you miss, complete it.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 636 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 608 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

It is forbidden to rush and run to the mosque to join the congregation. Even if the prayer has started or a rak'ah is about to be missed, one should walk normally.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ عَاشِرُوْهُنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ

And live with them (i.e., women) in kindness.

Surah An-Nisa, Verse 19 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

That is, you should fulfill all the rights of your wives properly. Do not cause them any unnecessary trouble. Do not place any unjust burden on them. Fulfill their maintenance according to your ability, and do not fall short in this regard. Also, maintain all etiquette in your behavior with them. Above all, live with them with justice, fairness, and generosity.

Narrated by Abu Dharr (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

فَمَنْ جَعَلَ اللَّهُ أَخَاهُ تَحْتَ يَدِهِ فَلْيُطْعِمْهُ مِمَّا يَأْكُلُ وَلْيُلْبِسْهُ مِمَّا يَلْبَسُ ، وَلاَ يُكَلِّفُهُ مِنَ الْعَمَلِ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ فَإِنْ كَلَّفَهُ مَا يَغْلِبُهُ فَلْيُعِنْهُ عَلَيْهِ

So, whoever Allah has placed his brother under his authority, let him feed him from what he eats and clothe him from what he wears. And let him not burden him with any work that is beyond his capacity. And if he has to burden him with such a difficult task, then he himself should help him with it.

Sahih Al-Bukhari, Hadith 6050 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5624 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

كُلُّ أُمَّتِي يَدْخُلُونَ الْجَنَّةَ إِلاَّ مَنْ أَبَى قَالُوا : يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ ، وَمَنْ يَأْبَى قَالَ مَنْ أَطَاعَنِي دَخَلَ الْجَنَّةَ ، وَمَنْ عَصَانِي فَقَدْ أَبَى.

All of my ummah will enter Paradise, except for those who refuse. They said, who will refuse? He said: Whoever follows me will enter Paradise. And whoever disobeys me has refused.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7280 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6783 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Usama Ibn Sharik (RA), he said,

قالت الأعراب يا رسول الله ألا نتداوى ؟ قال نعم يا عباد الله تداووا فإن الله لم يضع داء إلا وضع له شفاء أو قال دواء إلا داء واحد قالوا يا رسول الله وما هو ؟ قال الهرم

The Bedouin Arabs once said, 'O Messenger of Allah! Shall we not seek medical treatment?' He said, 'Yes, O servants of Allah! Seek medical treatment. Allah has not created any disease for which He has not provided a cure except for one disease.' The companions asked: 'O Messenger of Allah! What is that disease?' He said: 'Old age.'

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2038 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 2045 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by 'Aishah (RA),

أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَتَى النَّبِيَّ صَلَّى الله عَليْهِ وسَلَّمَ فَقَالَ : إِنَّ أُمِّي افْتُلِتَتْ نَفْسُهَا وَلَمْ تُوصِ ، وَإِنِّي أَظُنُّهَا لَوْ تَكَلَّمَتْ لَتَصَدَّقَتْ ، فَلَهَا أَجْرٌ إِنْ تَصَدَّقْتُ عَنْهَا وَلِيَ أَجْرٌ ؟ فَقَالَ : نَعَمْ.

A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said, 'My mother died suddenly and could not make a will. I think if she had been able to speak, she would have given in charity. If I give charity on her behalf, will he receive the reward for it, and will I as well?' He said, 'Yes.'

Sunan Ibn Majah, Hadith 2717 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Footnote:

This hadith indicates that if charity is given on behalf of a deceased person, both the deceased and the person giving the charity will be rewarded.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

وَ اَقِمِ الصَّلٰوةَ طَرَفَیِ النَّهَارِ وَ زُلَفًا مِّنَ الَّیْلِ ؕ اِنَّ الْحَسَنٰتِ یُذْهِبْنَ السَّیِّاٰتِ ؕ ذٰلِكَ ذِكْرٰی لِلذّٰكِرِیْنَۚ۝۱۱۴

And (O Prophet!) establish prayer at the two ends of the day and in some parts of the night. Indeed, good deeds remove evil deeds. This advice is for those who accept it.

Surah Hud, Verse 114

Footnote:

According to many commentators, the prayers at the two ends of the day here refer to the prayers before sunrise and sunset. The prayer before sunrise is Fajr, and the prayers before sunset are Dhuhr and Asr. The prayers of the night are intended to be Maghrib and Isha. In this way, this verse contains instructions for the five daily prayers. Some, however, have also mentioned Tahajjud, along with Maghrib and Isha, as the prayers of the night. [Based on Tafsir-e-Usmani]

Narrated by Anas ibn Malik (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

لاَ تَبَاغَضُوا ، وَلاَ تَحَاسَدُوا ، وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ إِخْوَانًا ، وَلاَ يَحِلُّ لِمُسْلِمٍ أَنْ يَهْجُرَ أَخَاهُ فَوْقَ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ.

Do not hate one another. Do not envy one another. Do not turn away from one another. All of you are servants of Allah, so become brothers to one another. It is not permissible for a Muslim to forsake his brother for more than three days (i.e., not to speak to him).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6065 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 5639 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by ‘Abdullah Ibn ‘Amr (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

يَحْضُرُ الْجُمُعَةَ ثَلاَثَةُ نَفَرٍ رَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا يَلْغُو وَهُوَ حَظُّهُ مِنْهَا وَرَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا يَدْعُو فَهُوَ رَجُلٌ دَعَا اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ إِنْ شَاءَ أَعْطَاهُ وَإِنْ شَاءَ مَنَعَهُ وَرَجُلٌ حَضَرَهَا بِإِنْصَاتٍ وَسُكُوتٍ وَلَمْ يَتَخَطَّ رَقَبَةَ مُسْلِمٍ وَلَمْ يُؤْذِ أَحَدًا فَهِىَ كَفَّارَةٌ إِلَى الْجُمُعَةِ الَّتِى تَلِيهَا وَزِيَادَةُ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ وَذَلِكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ يَقُولُ (مَنْ جَاءَ بِالْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُ عَشْرُ أَمْثَالِهَا)

One group of people attends Jumu‘ah but wanders about and engages in idle talk. Another group comes to Jumu‘ah and occupies themselves with supplications and the like; Allah may accept their supplications if He wills, or He may not. Another group attends the mosque and remains silent during the khutbah, neither stepping over people’s necks nor causing anyone harm. For such a person, this silence will be an expiation for sins from the previous Jumu‘ah until this one, and for an additional three days, because the Almighty and All-Powerful Allah has said: “Whoever does a good deed will be rewarded tenfold for it.”

Sunan Abu Dawood 1113 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

Footnote:

It is forbidden to cause trouble to anyone or to step over someone to go forward in the mosque. One should sit wherever one finds a place upon entering the mosque. However, from the beginning, everyone should sit in such a way that there are no empty spaces in the front rows, so that there is no need for people to step over others from behind to come forward. This rule applies to all prayers, including Jumu'ah.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا لَا تَدْخُلُوْا بُیُوْتًا غَیْرَ بُیُوْتِكُمْ حَتّٰی تَسْتَاْنِسُوْا وَ تُسَلِّمُوْا عَلٰۤی اَهْلِهَا ؕ ذٰلِكُمْ خَیْرٌ لَّكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُوْنَ۝۲۷ فَاِنْ لَّمْ تَجِدُوْا فِیْهَاۤ اَحَدًا فَلَا تَدْخُلُوْهَا حَتّٰی یُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ ۚ وَ اِنْ قِیْلَ لَكُمُ ارْجِعُوْا فَارْجِعُوْا هُوَ اَزْكٰی لَكُمْ ؕ وَ اللّٰهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُوْنَ عَلِیْمٌ۝۲۸

O believers, do not enter houses other than your own until you have asked permission and greeted their inhabitants. That is better for you. It is hoped that you will take heed. But if you find no one therein, do not enter until permission is granted to you. And if you are told, “Go back,” then go back. That is pure for you. And Allah is fully aware of whatever you do.

Surah An-Nur, Verses 27, 28

Narrated by Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ كَانَ لَهُ ثَلاَثُ بَنَاتٍ أَوْ ثَلاَثُ أَخَوَاتٍ أَوْ ابْنَتَانِ أَوْ أُخْتَانِ فَأَحْسَنَ صُحْبَتَهُنَّ وَاتَّقَى اللَّهَ فِيهِنَّ فَلَهُ الجَنَّةُ

Whoever has three daughters or three sisters, or two daughters or two sisters, and he treats them well and fears Allah regarding them (their rights), then Paradise is ordained for him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1916 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1922 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

اِنَّ الَّذِیْنَ اٰمَنُوْا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوْا ثُمَّ اٰمَنُوْا ثُمَّ كَفَرُوْا ثُمَّ ازْدَادُوْا كُفْرًا لَّمْ یَكُنِ اللّٰهُ لِیَغْفِرَ لَهُمْ وَ لَا لِیَهْدِیَهُمْ سَبِیْلًاؕ۝۱۳۷

Those who believed, then disbelieved, then believed, then disbelieved, then increased in disbelief - Allah will not forgive them, nor will He guide them to the right path.

Surah An-Nisa, Verse 137

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا أَكَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَلْعَقْ أَصَابِعَهُ ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَدْرِي فِي أَيَّتِهِنَّ البَرَكَةُ.

When one of you eats, he should lick his fingers, for he does not know in which of them the blessing lies.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1801 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1808 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Umar (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ شَرِبَ الخَمْرَ لَمْ تُقْبَلْ لَهُ صَلاَةٌ أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ تَابَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، فَإِنْ عَادَ الرَّابِعَةَ لَمْ يَقْبَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ صَلاَةً أَرْبَعِينَ صَبَاحًا ، فَإِنْ تَابَ لَمْ يَتُبِ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ ، وَسَقَاهُ مِنْ نَهْرِ الخَبَالِ قِيلَ : يَا أَبَا عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ : وَمَا نَهْرُ الخَبَالِ ؟ قَالَ : نَهْرٌ مِنْ صَدِيدِ أَهْلِ النَّارِ.

Whoever drinks alcohol, his prayer will not be accepted for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he drinks alcohol again, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he gets involved in drinking alcohol again, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will accept his repentance. If he gets involved in drinking alcohol for the fourth time, Allah will not accept his prayer for forty mornings (days). If he repents, Allah will not accept his repentance and will make him drink from the 'Nahrul Khabal'. It was asked, 'O Abu Abdur Rahman (Ibn Umar)! What is Nahrul Khabal?' He said, 'A river of pus of the people of Hell.'

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1862 (Verified by Bashar Awad and Ahmad Shakir) 1868 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

The matter of not being forgiven and the repentance not being accepted the fourth time is said as a warning. In another hadith, it is said that if one commits a sin seventy times a day and repents, Allah Ta'ala will also accept it.

Narrated by Ali (Zainul Abidin) Ibn Al-Husayn (may Allah have mercy on him), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ مِنْ حُсْنِ إِسْلاَمِ الْمَرْءِ تَرْكَهُ مَا لاَ يَعْنِيهِ.

One of the qualities of a person's Islam is to leave alone what does not concern him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2318 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 2321 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), Abu Huraira (RA) narrated from the Prophet (peace be upon him):

أَنَّ رَجُلاً زَارَ أَخًا لَهُ فِى قَرْيَةٍ أُخْرَى فَأَرْصَدَ اللَّهُ لَهُ عَلَى مَدْرَجَتِهِ مَلَكًا فَلَمَّا أَتَى عَلَيْهِ قَالَ أَيْنَ تُرِيدُ قَالَ أُرِيدُ أَخًا لِى فِى هَذِهِ الْقَرْيَةِ. قَالَ هَلْ لَكَ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ نِعْمَةٍ تَرُبُّهَا قَالَ لاَ غَيْرَ أَنِّى أَحْبَبْتُهُ فِى اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَجَلَّ. قَالَ فَإِنِّى رَسُولُ اللَّهِ إِلَيْكَ بِأَنَّ اللَّهَ قَدْ أَحَبَّكَ كَمَا أَحْبَبْتَهُ فِيهِ

A man went to visit his brother in another village. Allah Ta'ala appointed an angel for him on the road. When the man reached the angel, the angel asked, 'Where do you intend to go?' He said, 'I am going to visit a brother of mine in this village.' The angel said, 'Do you have any favor upon him that you want to increase?' He said, 'No. I only love him for the sake of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic.' The angel said, 'I have come to you with a message from Allah that Allah also loves you, just as you have loved your brother for His sake.'

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2567 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6316 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Ibn Mas'ud (RA), he said,

لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللهِ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ آكِلَ الرِّبَا ، وَمُوكِلَهُ ، وَشَاهِدَيْهِ ، وَكَاتِبَهُ.

The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) cursed the one who consumes usury, the one who gives it, the two who witness it, and the one who writes it (the contract or account).

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 1206 (Verified by Ahmad Shakir) 1209 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

الرِّبَا سَبْعُونَ حُوبًا، أَيْسَرُهَا أَنْ يَنْكِحَ الرَّجُلُ أُمَّهُ

Usury is a collection of seventy types of sins. The easiest of them is for a man to commit adultery with his own mother.

Sunan Ibn Majah 2274 Islamic Foundation Bangladesh

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

یٰۤاَیُّهَا النَّبِیُّ قُلْ لِّاَزْوَاجِكَ وَ بَنٰتِكَ وَ نِسَآءِ الْمُؤْمِنِیْنَ یُدْنِیْنَ عَلَیْهِنَّ مِنْ جَلَابِیْبِهِنَّ ؕ ذٰلِكَ اَدْنٰۤی اَنْ یُّعْرَفْنَ فَلَا یُؤْذَیْنَ ؕ وَ كَانَ اللّٰهُ غَفُوْرًا رَّحِیْمًا۝

O Prophet! Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. This will make them more easily recognized, and thus they will not be harassed. Allah is most Forgiving and Merciful.

Surah Al-Ahzab, Verse 59 Source: Tafsir Tawzihul Quran

Footnote:

This verse proves that a woman's face is also part of her hijab. There is no scope for keeping the face uncovered in front of non-mahram men.

In the Holy Quran, Allah Ta'ala says,

كُنْتُمْ خَیْرَ اُمَّةٍ اُخْرِجَتْ لِلنَّاسِ تَاْمُرُوْنَ بِالْمَعْرُوْفِ وَ تَنْهَوْنَ عَنِ الْمُنْكَرِ وَ تُؤْمِنُوْنَ بِاللّٰهِ ؕ وَ لَوْ اٰمَنَ اَهْلُ الْكِتٰبِ لَكَانَ خَیْرًا لَّهُمْ ؕ مِنْهُمُ الْمُؤْمِنُوْنَ وَ اَكْثَرُهُمُ الْفٰسِقُوْنَ۝۱۱۰

(O Muslims!) You are the best community brought forth for the benefit of mankind. You enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and believe in Allah. If the People of the Book (the Jews and Christians) had believed, it would have been better for them. Among them are believers, but most of them are defiantly disobedient.

Surah Aal-i-Imran, Verse 110

Narrated by Jabir (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عز وجل عِنْدَ كُلِّ فِطْرٍ عُتَقَاءَ، وَذَلِكَ فِي كُلِّ لَيْلَةٍ

Allah Ta'ala frees a large number of people (from Hell) at the time of every Iftar. And this happens every night.

Narrated by Aisha (RA), she said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

Footnote:
Although every deed of the son of Adam is done for Allah, this hadith specifically mentions fasting as being “for Allah” because fasting is an act performed purely for His sake. Other acts of worship can sometimes be tainted with riya (showing off), but fasting is concealed and solely for Allah’s pleasure. Some narrations further explain: “He abandons his desires for My sake,” meaning that a person gives up food, drink, and sexual desires solely for Allah’s satisfaction, leaving no room for riya in fasting.

And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands’ fathers, their sons, their husbands’ sons, their brothers, their brothers’ sons, their sisters’ sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

Surah An-Nur Ayat 31

Footnote:
In this verse, women are commanded to cover their entire bodies with a large cloak or veil (jilbab or burqa) in front of non-mahram men (men who are not closely related to them), so that the adornments of their bodies are not seen. However, if any part of the body becomes exposed unintentionally during work or needs to be uncovered due to a specific necessity, there is no sin in that. Regarding this, it is stated: “Except what [ordinarily] appears thereof.” Ibn Jarir al-Tabari (rahimahullah) mentioned in his Tafsir that Abdullah ibn Mas‘ud (RA) said this exception refers to the outer garment (jilbab or burqa) itself, which women use to cover their bodies, as it is not possible to conceal that garment itself. (Meaning: women must not expose their bodies or jewelry in front of non-mahram men, but the garment they use to cover themselves can be visible to men.) Abdullah ibn Abbas (RA) explained that if, out of necessity, the face or hands need to be uncovered, this verse permits it. However, since the face is the focal point of beauty, it must ordinarily remain covered, as also commanded in Surah Al-Ahzab (33:59). Yes, in cases of necessity, uncovering the face is allowed, but at that time, men are instructed to lower their gaze.

Surah Al-Baqarah, Ayah 281

Narrated Abu Hurairah (RA), he said, I heard the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) say,

إِنَّ عَبْدًا أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا - فَقَالَ رَبِّ أَذْنَبْتُ ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَصَبْتُ - فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَقَالَ رَبُّهُ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخُذُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي ثُمَّ مَكَثَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا ، أَوْ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا فَقَالَ رَبِّ أَذْنَبْتُ ، أَوْ أَصَبْتُ - آخَرَ فَاغْفِرْهُ فَقَالَ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخُذُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي ثُمَّ مَكَثَ مَا شَاءَ اللَّهُ ثُمَّ أَذْنَبَ ذَنْبًا ، وَرُبَّمَا قَالَ أَصَابَ ذَنْبًا- قَالَ : قَالَ رَبِّ أَصَبْتُ ، أَوْ أَذْنَبْتُ - آخَرَ فَاغْفِرْهُ لِي فَقَالَ أَعَلِمَ عَبْدِي أَنَّ لَهُ رَبًّا يَغْفِرُ الذَّنْبَ وَيَأْخُذُ بِهِ غَفَرْتُ لِعَبْدِي - ثَلاَثًا - فَلْيَعْمَلْ مَا شَاءَ.

I heard the Prophet (ﷺ) saying, "If somebody commits a sin and then says, 'O my Lord! I have sinned, please forgive me!' and his Lord says, 'My slave has known that he has a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for it, I therefore have forgiven my slave (his sins).' Then he remains without committing any sin for a while and then again commits another sin and says, 'O my Lord, I have committed another sin, please forgive me,' and Allah says, 'My slave has known that he has a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for it, I therefore have forgiven my slave (his sin). Then he remains without Committing any another sin for a while and then commits another sin (for the third time) and says, 'O my Lord, I have committed another sin, please forgive me,' and Allah says, 'My slave has known that he has a Lord Who forgives sins and punishes for it I therefore have forgiven My slave (his sin), he can do whatever he likes."

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7507 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6998 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَرَدَّى مِنْ جَبَلٍ فَقَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ فَهْوَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ يَتَرَدَّى فِيهِ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا ، وَمَنْ تَحَسَّى سَمًّا فَقَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ فَسَمُّهُ فِي يَدِهِ يَتَحَسَّاهُ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا ، وَمَنْ قَتَلَ نَفْسَهُ بِحَدِيدَةٍ فَحَدِيدَتُهُ فِي يَدِهِ يَجَأُ بِهَا فِي بَطْنِهِ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَالِدًا مُخَلَّدًا فِيهَا أَبَدًا.

The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Whoever purposely throws himself from a mountain and kills himself, will be in the (Hell) Fire falling down into it and abiding therein perpetually forever; and whoever drinks poison and kills himself with it, he will be carrying his poison in his hand and drinking it in the (Hell) Fire wherein he will abide eternally forever; and whoever kills himself with an iron weapon, will be carrying that weapon in his hand and stabbing his `Abdomen with it in the (Hell) Fire wherein he will abide eternally forever."

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5778 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5363 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Qatadah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said,

إِذَا شَرِبَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلاَ يَتَنَفَّسْ فِي الإِنَاءِ ، وَإِذَا أَتَى الْخَلاَءَ فَلاَ يَمَسَّ ذَكَرَهُ بِيَمِينِهِ ، وَلاَ يَتَمَسَّحْ بِيَمِينِهِ.

Whenever anyone of you drinks water, he should not breathe in the drinking utensil, and whenever anyone of you goes to a lavatory, he should neither touch his penis nor clean his private parts with his right hand.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 153 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 155 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

The Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said,

لَوِ اطَّلَعَ فِي بَيْتِكَ أَحَدٌ وَلَمْ تَأْذَنْ لَهُ خَذَفْتَهُ بِحَصَاةٍ فَفَقَأْتَ عَيْنَهُ مَا كَانَ عَلَيْكَ مِنْ جُنَاحٍ

If someone were to peek into your house without your permission, and you threw a stone at him and it injured his eye, there would be no sin upon you.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6888 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6421 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
From this, it is understood that not only is it forbidden to enter someone’s house without permission, but even peeking inside without consent is considered a serious wrongdoing.

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA),

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا أَوَى إِلَى فِرَاشِهِ كُلَّ لَيْلَةٍ جَمَعَ كَفَّيْهِ ثُمَّ نَفَثَ فِيهِمَا فَقَرَأَ فِيهِمَا {قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ} ، وَ{قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ} ، وَ{قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ} ثُمَّ يَمْسَحُ بِهِمَا مَا اسْتَطَاعَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ يَبْدَأُ بِهِمَا عَلَى رَأْسِهِ وَوَجْهِهِ وَمَا أَقْبَلَ مِنْ جَسَدِهِ يَفْعَلُ ذَلِكَ ثَلاَثَ مَرَّاتٍ.

Whenever the Prophet (ﷺ) went to bed every night, he used to cup his hands together and blow over them after reciting Surat Al-Ikhlas, Surat Al-Falaq, and Surat An-Nas, and then rub his hands over whatever parts of his body he was able to rub, starting with his head, face, and front of his body. He used to do that three times.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5017 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 4648 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by `Aisha (RA), 

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا اغْتَسَلَ مِنَ الْجَنَابَةِ بَدَأَ فَغَسَلَ يَدَيْهِ ثُمَّ يَتَوَضَّأُ كَمَا يَتَوَضَّأُ لِلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ يُدْخِلُ أَصَابِعَهُ فِي الْمَاءِ فَيُخَلِّلُ بِهَا أُصُولَ شَعَرِهِ ثُمَّ يَصُبُّ عَلَى رَأْسِهِ ثَلاَثَ غُرَفٍ بِيَدَيْهِ ثُمَّ يُفِيضُ الْمَاءَ عَلَى جِلْدِهِ كُلِّهِ.

When the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) performed the ritual bath (ghusl) for major impurity (janabah), he would first wash his hands. Then he would perform ablution (wudu) similar to the ablution for prayer. After that, he would dip his fingers into water and run them through the roots of his hair. Then he would pour three handfuls of water over his head, and finally, he would pour water over his entire body.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 248 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 246 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Dharr (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

لَوْلاَ أَنْ أَشُقَّ عَلَى أُمَّتِي ، أَوْ عَلَى النَّاسِ - لأَمَرْتُهُمْ بِالسِّوَاكِ مَعَ كُلِّ صَلاَةٍ.

If I had not found it hard for my followers or the people, I would have ordered them to clean their teeth with Siwak for every prayer.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 887 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 843 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
Chewing the twig of a tree to soften it and then using it to clean the teeth and mouth is known as miswak. It is Sunnah to use the miswak after waking up from sleep, at the time of performing ablution (wudu), when there is a change in mouth odor, while reciting the Qur’an, and upon entering the house.

Narrated by 'Ubada bin As-Samit (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

مَنْ تَعَارَّ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ فَقَالَ : لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسُبْحَانَ اللهِ ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ ، وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي ، أَوْ دَعَا اسْتُجِيبَ فَإِنْ تَوَضَّأَ وَصَلَّى قُبِلَتْ صَلاَتُهُ.

Whoever gets up at night and says لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ، وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ، وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَىْءٍ قَدِيرٌ‏.‏ الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، وَسُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ، وَلاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ، وَاللَّهُ أَكْبَرُ، وَلاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ‏. (None has the right to be worshipped but Allah. He is the Only One and has no partners. For Him is the Kingdom, and all the praises are due to Him. He is Omnipotent. All praises are for Allah. All the glories are for Allah. And none has the right to be worshipped but Allah, And Allah is Great, And there is neither Might nor Power Except with Allah). And then says اللَّهُمَّ اغْفِرْ لِي‏. (O Allah! Forgive me.) Or invokes (Allah), he will be responded to, and if he performs ablution (and prays), his prayer will be accepted.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1154 (verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 1087 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated ʿA’ishah (RA), The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

إِذَا نَعَسَ أَحَدُكُمْ وَهُوَ يُصَلِّي فَلْيَرْقُدْ حَتَّى يَذْهَبَ عَنْهُ النَّوْمُ فَإِنَّ أَحَدَكُمْ إِذَا صَلَّى وَهُوَ نَاعِسٌ لاَ يَدْرِي لَعَلَّهُ يَسْتَغْفِرُ فَيَسُبَّ نَفْسَهُ

If any of you feels drowsy while performing Salah, let him sleep until the drowsiness leaves him. For if he prays while drowsy, he may not realize he might seek forgiveness but end up cursing himself instead.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 212 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated ‘Abdullah ibn ‘Umar (RA), The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

إِذَا جَاءَ أَحَدُكُمُ الْجُمُعَةَ فَلْيَغْتَسِلْ.

When one of you comes for Jumu’ah (Friday prayer), he should perform Ghusl (ritual bath).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 877 (verified by Fu’ād Abdul Bāqī) 833 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated Abu Huraira (RA), The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) spoke about the day of Jumu’ah (Friday) and said,

فِيهِ سَاعَةٌ لاَ يُوَافِقُهَا عَبْدٌ مُسْلِمٌ وَهْوَ قَائِمٌ يُصَلِّي يَسْأَلُ اللَّهَ تَعَالَى شَيْئًا إِلاَّ أَعْطَاهُ إِيَّاهُ . وَأَشَارَ بِيَدِهِ يُقَلِّلُهَا.

On this day, there is a moment when, if any Muslim servant (of Allah) stands in prayer and asks Allah for something, He will surely grant it to him.” And he gestured with his hand to indicate how brief that moment is.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 935 (verified by Fu’ād Abdul Bāqī) 888 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA),

أَوْصَانِي خَلِيلِي بِثَلاَثٍ لاَ أَدَعُهُنَّ حَتَّى أَمُوتَ صَوْمِ ثَلاَثَةِ أَيَّامٍ مِنْ كُلِّ شَهْرٍ وَصَلاَةِ الضُّحَى وَنَوْمٍ عَلَى وِتْرٍ.

My close friend and beloved, the Prophet (ﷺ), advised me regarding three deeds which I will never abandon until the day I die: fasting three days every month, offering the Duha (forenoon) prayer, and performing the Witr prayer before sleeping.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 1178 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 1108 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Ka‘b ibn Mālik (RA) reported,

أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ إِذَا قَدِمَ مِنْ سَفَرٍ ضُحًى دَخَلَ الْمَسْجِدَ فَصَلَّى رَكْعَتَيْنِ قَبْلَ أَنْ يَجْلِسَ.

When the Prophet (ﷺ) returned from a journey during the forenoon, he would enter the mosque and perform two rak‘ahs (units) of prayer before sitting down.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 3088 (verified by Fu’ād Abdul Bāqī) 2870 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا اسْتَأْذَنَ أَحَدُكُمْ ثَلاَثًا فَلَمْ يُؤْذَنْ لَهُ فَلْيَرْجِعْ

If any of you seeks permission (to enter someone’s house) three times and is not granted permission, then he should return.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6045 (Verified by Fu’ād Abdul Bāqī), 5811 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Musa (RA), he said,

وُلِدَ لِي غُلاَمٌ فَأَتَيْتُ بِهِ النَّبِيَّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَسَمَّاهُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ فَحَنَّكَهُ بِتَمْرَةٍ وَدَعَا لَهُ بِالْبَرَكَةِ وَدَفَعَهُ إِلَيَّ.

I had a son born to me, so I took him to the Prophet ﷺ. He named him Ibrāhīm, then performed tahnik for him with a date (i.e., he chewed a date and put it in the baby's mouth), and he made duʿāʾ for blessings for him and gave him back to me.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5467 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5071 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

إِذَا انْتَعَلَ أَحَدُكُمْ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالْيَمِينِ ، وَإِذَا نَزَعَ فَلْيَبْدَأْ بِالشِّمَالِ لِتَكُنِ الْيُمْنَى أَوَّلَهُمَا تُنْعَلُ وَآخِرَهُمَا تُنْزَعُ.

If you want to put on your shoes, put on the right shoe first; and if you want to take them off, take the left one first. Let the right shoe be the first to be put on and the last to be taken off.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 5855 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5437 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
That is, it is Sunnah to put on the right shoe first when wearing shoes, and to take off the left shoe first when removing them.

Narrated by Ibn ‘Abbas (RA),

أَنَّ رَسُولَ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم شَرِبَ لَبَنًا فَمَضْمَضَ وَقَالَ إِنَّ لَهُ دَسَمًا.

The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) drank milk and then rinsed his mouth, saying, “It contains fat (greasiness).

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 211 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), he said,

مَا عَابَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم طَعَامًا قَطُّ إِنِ اشْتَهَاهُ أَكَلَهُ وَإِنْ كَرِهَهُ تَرَكَهُ.

The Prophet (ﷺ) never criticized any food (he was invited to), but he used to eat if he liked the food, and leave it if he disliked it.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 5409 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5015 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

إِيَّاكُمْ وَالظَّنَّ فَإِنَّ الظَّنَّ أَكْذَبُ الْحَدِيثِ ، وَلاَ تَحَسَّسُوا ، وَلاَ تَجَسَّسُوا ، وَلاَ تَنَاجَشُوا ، وَلاَ تَحَاسَدُوا ، وَلاَ تَبَاغَضُوا ، وَلاَ تَدَابَرُوا وَكُونُوا عِبَادَ اللهِ إِخْوَانًا.

Beware of suspicion, for suspicion is the worst of false tales. and do not look for the others' faults, and do not do spying on one another, and do not practice Najsh, and do not be jealous of one another, and do not hate one another, and do not desert (stop talking to) one another. And O, Allah's worshipers! Be brothers!

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6066 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5640 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
The "suspicion" mentioned here refers to harboring negative assumptions about others without clear evidence.
Assuming the worst about someone based on mere speculation is a sinful act in Islam.

Narrated Al-Aswad (RA),

سَأَلْتُ عَائِشَةَ مَا كَانَ النَّبِيُّ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَصْنَعُ فِي بَيْتِهِ قَالَتْ كَانَ يَكُونُ فِي مِهْنَةِ أَهْلِهِ - تَعْنِي خِدْمَةَ أَهْلِهِ - فَإِذَا حَضَرَتِ الصَّلاَةُ خَرَجَ إِلَى الصَّلاَةِ.

I asked `Aisha "What did the Prophet (ﷺ) use to do in his house?" She replied, "He used to keep himself busy serving his family, and when it was time for prayer, he would go for it.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 676 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 642 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:
This hadith shows that when a man is at home, assisting his wife with household chores is a highly rewarding deed. And if this help is offered to one's mother in her tasks, then the reward is even greater.

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA),

أَنَّ رَجُلاً قَالَ لِلنَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم أَوْصِنِي قَالَ : لاَ تَغْضَبْ فَرَدَّدَ مِرَارًا قَالَ : لاَ تَغْضَبْ.

A man said to the Prophet (ﷺ), "Advise me! "The Prophet (ﷺ) said, "Do not become angry." The man asked (the same) again and again, and the Prophet (ﷺ) said in each case, "Do not become angry.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6116 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 1327 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated from Uthman ibn Affan (RA), he said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say,

مَنْ بَنَى مَسْجِدًا يَبْتَغِي بِهِ وَجْهَ اللهِ بَنَى اللَّهُ لَهُ مِثْلَهُ فِي الْجَنَّةِ.

Whoever builds a mosque seeking the pleasure of Allah, Allah will build for him a similar house in Paradise.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 450 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 437 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Umar (RA) said, I heard the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) say,

لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَوَكَّلُونَ عَلَى اللهِ حَقَّ تَوَكُّلِهِ لَرُزِقْتُمْ كَمَا يُرْزَقُ الطَّيْرُ تَغْدُو خِمَاصًا وَتَرُوحُ بِطَانًا.

If you were to rely upon Allah with true reliance, He would provide for you as He provides for the birds: they go out in the morning with empty stomachs and return in the evening with full bellies.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2344

Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ قَالَ - يَعْنِي ، إِذَا خَرَجَ مِنْ بَيْتِهِ -: بِسْمِ اللهِ ، تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ ، لاَ حَوْلَ وَلاَ قُوَّةَ إِلاَّ بِاللَّهِ ، يُقَالُ لَهُ : كُفِيتَ ، وَوُقِيتَ ، وَتَنَحَّى عَنْهُ الشَّيْطَانُ.

Whoever says (when he leaves his house): بِسْمِ اللهِ تَوَكَّلْتُ عَلَى اللهِ وَلَا حَوْلَ وَلَا قُوَّةَ اِلَّا بِاللهِ (In the Name of Allah, I place my trust in Allah, there is no might or power except by Allah). It is said to him, You have been sufficed and protected. And Shaitan will become distant from him.

Jami` at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 3426

Narrated by Abu Huraira (RA), the Messenger (peace be upon him) said,

إِنَّ اللَّهَ قَالَ مَنْ عَادَى لِي وَلِيًّا فَقَدْ آذَنْتُهُ بِالْحَرْبِ وَمَا تَقَرَّبَ إِلَيَّ عَبْدِي بِشَيْءٍ أَحَبَّ إِلَيَّ مِمَّا افْتَرَضْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَمَا يَزَالُ عَبْدِي يَتَقَرَّبُ إِلَيَّ بِالنَّوَافِلِ حَتَّى أُحِبَّهُ فَإِذَا أَحْبَبْتُهُ كُنْتُ سَمْعَهُ الَّذِي يَسْمَعُ بِهِ وَبَصَرَهُ الَّذِي يُبْصِرُ بِهِ وَيَدَهُ الَّتِي يَبْطُشُ بِهَا وَرِجْلَهُ الَّتِي يَمْشِي بِهَا وَإِنْ سَأَلَنِي لأُعْطِيَنَّهُ وَلَئِنِ اسْتَعَاذَنِي لأُعِيذَنَّهُ

Allah said, 'I will declare war against him who shows hostility to a pious worshipper of Mine. And the most beloved things with which My slave comes nearer to Me, is what I have enjoined upon him; and My slave keeps on coming closer to Me through performing Nawafil (praying or doing extra deeds besides what is obligatory) till I love him, so I become his sense of hearing with which he hears, and his sense of sight with which he sees, and his hand with which he grips, and his leg with which he walks; and if he asks Me, I will give him, and if he asks My protection (Refuge), I will protect him; (i.e. give him My Refuge) and I do not hesitate to do anything as I hesitate to take the soul of the believer, for he hates death, and I hate to disappoint him.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 6502

Footnote:

This hadith indicates that when a servant continues to engage in voluntary (nafl) deeds along with the obligatory (fard) acts, Allah begins to love them. As a result, the servant becomes a beloved friend (wali) of Allah. When this happens, Allah "becomes" their hearing, sight, hands, and feet. This does not mean that Allah takes a human form or literally becomes their body parts. Rather, it means that Allah helps and guides them in using these faculties in the right way. Most sins are committed through these body parts, but when a person becomes a wali of Allah, they are protected by His help. Such a person does not listen to anything unlawful or useless, but only hears what pleases Allah. They do not look at anything forbidden, but rather at things that bring reward. They do not use their hands for sinful acts, but for deeds that benefit their Hereafter. They do not walk towards what is forbidden, but move in ways that bring good in this world and the next.

Narrated by 'Abdullah ibn 'Abbas (RA), The Prophet (ﷺ) said,

نِعْمَتَانِ مَغْبُونٌ فِيهِمَا كَثِيرٌ مِنَ النَّاسِ الصِّحَّةُ وَالْفَرَاغ.

There are two blessings that many people are deceived into losing: health and free time.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6412

Footnote:

Teachings from the Hadith:
a. Good health is a great blessing from Allah, and it is necessary to express gratitude for it.
b. Since good health is a major favor from Allah, it is essential to take care of it and preserve it.
c. People often waste their free time, even though it is a great opportunity for worship and devotion. Therefore, everyone should make proper use of this valuable time.
d. Good health and free time are like capital for earning rewards. So every person has to ensure that this capital is not wasted except in ways that lead to reward and benefit.

Narrated by 'Aisha (RA),

أَنَّ نَبِيَّ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم كَانَ يَقُومُ مِنَ اللَّيْلِ حَتَّى تَتَفَطَّرَ قَدَمَاهُ فَقَالَتْ عَائِشَةُ لِمَ تَصْنَعُ هَذَا يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ وَقَدْ غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَكَ مَا تَقَدَّمَ مِنْ ذَنْبِكَ وَمَا تَأَخَّرَ قَالَ أَفَلاَ أُحِبُّ أَنْ أَكُونَ عَبْدًا شَكُورًا

The Prophet (ﷺ) used to offer prayer at night (for such a long time) that his feet used to crack. I said, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Why do you do it since Allah has forgiven you your faults of the past and those to follow?" He said, "Shouldn't I love to be a thankful slave (of Allah)?'

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 4837 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 44778 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

الْمُؤْمِنُ الْقَوِىُّ خَيْرٌ وَأَحَبُّ إِلَى اللَّهِ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِ الضَّعِيفِ وَفِى كُلٍّ خَيْرٌ احْرِصْ عَلَى مَا يَنْفَعُكَ وَاسْتَعِنْ بِاللَّهِ وَلاَ تَعْجِزْ وَإِنْ أَصَابَكَ شَىْءٌ فَلاَ تَقُلْ لَوْ أَنِّى فَعَلْتُ كَانَ كَذَا وَكَذَا. وَلَكِنْ قُلْ قَدَرُ اللَّهِ وَمَا شَاءَ فَعَلَ فَإِنَّ لَوْ تَفْتَحُ عَمَلَ الشَّيْطَانِ

A strong believer is better and is more lovable to Allah than a weak believer, and there is good in everyone, (but) cherish that which gives you benefit (in the Hereafter) and seek help from Allah and do not lose heart, and if anything (in the form of trouble) comes to you, don't say: If I had not done that, it would not have happened so and so, but say: Allah did that what He had ordained to do and your "if" opens the (gate) for the Satan.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2664 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6532 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

حُجِبَتِ النَّارُ بِالشَّهَوَاتِ وَحُجِبَتِ الْجَنَّةُ بِالْمَكَارِهِ.

The (Hell) Fire is surrounded by all kinds of desires and passions, while Paradise is surrounded by all kinds of disliked undesirable things.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6487 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6043 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Anas (RA), the Prophet (peace be upon him) said,

يَتْبَعُ الْمَيِّتَ ثَلاَثَةٌ فَيَرْجِعُ اثْنَانِ وَيَبْقَى مَعَهُ وَاحِدٌ يَتْبَعُهُ أَهْلُهُ وَمَالُهُ وَعَمَلُهُ فَيَرْجِعُ أَهْلُهُ وَمَالُهُ وَيَبْقَى عَمَلُهُ.

When carried to his grave, a dead person is followed by three, two of whom return (after his burial) and one remains with him: his relative, his property, and his deeds follow him; relatives and his property go back, while his deeds remain with him.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6514 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6070 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

It is narrated on the authority of Sufyan b. 'Abdulla al-Thaqafi that he said,

قُلْتُ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قُلْ لِى فِى الإِسْلاَمِ قَوْلاً لاَ أَسْأَلُ عَنْهُ أَحَدًا بَعْدَكَ - وَفِى حَدِيثِ أَبِى أُسَامَةَ غَيْرَكَ - قَالَ « قُلْ آمَنْتُ بِاللَّهِ فَاسْتَقِمْ »

I asked the Messenger of Allah to tell me about Islam, a thing which might dispense with the necessity of my asking anybody after you. In the hadith of Abu Usama the words are: other than you. He (the Holy Prophet) remarked: Say I affirm my faith in Allah and then remain steadfast to it.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 38 (as verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 66 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Footnote:

Being firmly established in faith (Iman) means to follow all the commands of the Shari’ah exactly as instructed without adding or omitting anything. It involves not deviating in any direction, avoiding both excessiveness and negligence. Additionally, one must completely abstain from everything that has been prohibited.

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (RA) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

قَارِبُوا ، وَسَدِّدُوا ، فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ أَحَدٌ مِنْكُمْ يُنْجِيهِ عَمَلُهُ ، قَالُوا : وَلاَ أَنْتَ ؟ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ ، قَالَ : وَلاَ أَنَا ، إِلاَّ أَنْ يَتَغَمَّدَنِي اللَّهُ بِرَحْمَةٍ مِنْهُ ، وَفَضْلٍ.

Be moderate and adhere to moderation, for there is no one among you who will be saved by his deeds.” They said: “Not even you, O Messenger of Allah?” He said: “Not even me. Unless Allah encompasses me with mercy and grace from Him.

Sahih Ibn Majah, Hadith 4201

It was narrated from Abu Ya’la Shaddad bin Aws (RA) that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

الْكَيِّسُ مَنْ دَانَ نَفْسَهُ ، وَعَمِلَ لِمَا بَعْدَ الْمَوْتِ ، وَالْعَاجِزُ ، مَنْ أَتْبَعَ نَفْسَهُ هَوَاهَا ، ثُمَّ تَمَنَّى عَلَى اللَّهِ.

The wise man is the one who takes account of himself and strives for that which is after death. And the helpless man is the one who follows his whims, then indulges in wishful thinking about Allah.

Sunan Ibn Majah 4260

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَادِرُوا بِالأَعْمَالِ فِتَنًا كَقِطَعِ اللَّيْلِ الْمُظْلِمِ يُصْبِحُ الرَّجُلُ مُؤْمِنًا وَيُمْسِى كَافِرًا أَوْ يُمْسِى مُؤْمِنًا وَيُصْبِحُ كَافِرًا يَبِيعُ دِينَهُ بِعَرَضٍ مِنَ الدُّنْيَا

Be prompt in doing good deeds (before you are overtaken) by turbulence, which would be like a part of the night. During that stormy period, a man would be a Muslim in the morning and an unbeliever in the evening, or he would be a believer in the evening and an unbeliever in the morning and would sell his faith for worldly goods.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 118, Jami At-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2195

Narrated by Abu Huraira,

جَاءَ رَجُلٌ إِلَى النَّبِيِّ صلى الله عليه وسلم فَقَالَ يَا رَسُولَ اللهِ أَيُّ الصَّدَقَةِ أَعْظَمُ أَجْرًا قَالَ : أَنْ تَصَدَّقَ وَأَنْتَ صَحِيحٌ شَحِيحٌ تَخْشَى الْفَقْرَ وَتَأْمُلُ الْغِنَى ، وَلاَ تُمْهِلُ حَتَّى إِذَا بَلَغَتِ الْحُلْقُومَ قُلْتَ لِفُلاَنٍ كَذَا وَلِفُلاَنٍ كَذَا وَقَدْ كَانَ لِفُلاَنٍ.

A man came to the Prophet (ﷺ) and asked, "O Allah's Messenger (ﷺ)! Which charity is the most superior in reward?" He replied, "The charity which you practice while you are healthy, niggardly and afraid of poverty, and wish to become wealthy. Do not delay it to the time of approaching death and then say, 'Give so much to such and such, and so much to such and such.' And it has already belonged to such and such (as it is too late).

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 1419, Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1032

Narrated Az-Zubair bin `Adi, We went to Anas bin Malik and complained about the wrong we were suffering at the hand of Al-Hajjaj. Anas bin Malik said,

اصْبِرُوا ، فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَأْتِي عَلَيْكُمْ زَمَانٌ إِلاَّ الَّذِي بَعْدَهُ شَرٌّ مِنْهُ حَتَّى تَلْقَوْا رَبَّكُمْ سَمِعْتُهُ مِنْ نَبِيِّكُمْ صلى الله عليه وسلم

Be patient till you meet your Lord, for no time will come upon you but the time following it will be worse than it. I heard that from the Prophet.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 7068

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (RA), The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said,

بَادِرُوا بِالأَعْمَالِ سَبْعًا هَلْ تُنْظَرُونَ إِلاَّ إِلَى فَقْرٍ مُنْسٍ ، أَوْ غِنًى مُطْغٍ ، أَوْ مَرَضٍ مُفْسِدٍ ، أَوْ هَرَمٍ مُفَنِّدٍ ، أَوْ مَوْتٍ مُجْهِزٍ ، أَوِ الدَّجَّالِ فَشَرُّ غَائِبٍ يُنْتَظَرُ ، أَوِ السَّاعَةِ فَالسَّاعَةُ أَدْهَى وَأَمَرُّ.

Race to do works against seven. Are you waiting for overwhelming poverty, or distracting richness, or debilitating illness, or babbling senility, or sudden death, or the Dajjal, so that hidden evil is what is awaited, or the Hour? The Hour is more calamitous and more bitter.

Jami At-Tirmidhi, Hadith 2306 (Verified by Bashshar Awwad)

Rabi'a Ibn Ka'b narrated,

كُنْتُ أَبِيتُ مَعَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- فَأَتَيْتُهُ بِوَضُوئِهِ وَحَاجَتِهِ فَقَالَ لِى « سَلْ ». فَقُلْتُ أَسْأَلُكَ مُرَافَقَتَكَ فِى الْجَنَّةِ. قَالَ « أَوَغَيْرَ ذَلِكَ ». قُلْتُ هُوَ ذَاكَ. قَالَ « فَأَعِنِّى عَلَى نَفْسِكَ بِكَثْرَةِ السُّجُودِ »

I was with Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) one night. And I brought him water and what he required. He said to me: Ask (anything you like). I said: I ask your company in Paradise. He (the Holy Prophet) said: Or anything else besides it. I said: That is all (what I require). He said: Then help me to achieve this for you by devoting yourself often to prostration.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 489 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Footnote:

In this hadith, "making more prostrations" refers to offering more prayers. A servant can attain the closest proximity to Allah through prayer. And within the prayer, it is during prostration that the servant becomes the closest to Allah.

Salama b. Akwa' reported,

أَنَّ رَجُلاً أَكَلَ عِنْدَ رَسُولِ اللَّهِ -صلى الله عليه وسلم- بِشِمَالِهِ فَقَالَ « كُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ ». قَالَ لاَ أَسْتَطِيعُ قَالَ « لاَ اسْتَطَعْتَ ». مَا مَنَعَهُ إِلاَّ الْكِبْرُ. قَالَ فَمَا رَفَعَهَا إِلَى فِيهِ.

A person ate in the presence of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) with his left hand, whereupon he said, Eat with your right hand. He said: I cannot do that, whereupon he (the Holy Prophet) said: May you not be able to do that. It was vanity that prevented him from doing it, and he could not raise it (right hand) up to his mouth.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2021 (authenticated by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Narrated `Abdullah (RA), Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

لاَ تُقْتَلُ نَفْسٌ ظُلْمًا إِلاَّ كَانَ عَلَى ابْنِ آدَمَ الأَوَّلِ كِفْلٌ مِنْ دَمِهَا لأَنَّهُ أَوَّلُ مَنْ سَنَّ الْقَتْلَ.

Whenever a person is murdered unjustly, there is a share of the burden of the crime on the first son of Adam, for he was the first to start the tradition of murdering.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 3335 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Narrated by Abu Mas’ud ‘Uqbah ibn ‘Amr (RA), the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ دَلَّ عَلَى خَيْرٍ فَلَهُ مِثْلُ أَجْرِ فَاعِلِهِ

Whoever guides someone to a good deed will have a reward like that of the one who performs it.v

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 1893

Footnote:

The one who encourages or guides others to do good deeds will receive the same reward as the doer. So if we motivate someone toward a righteous act, we will continue to earn a reward as long as that person keeps doing it. Even after our death, the reward will keep being recorded in our book of deeds.

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

مَنْ دَعَا إِلَى هُدًى كَانَ لَهُ مِنَ الأَجْرِ مِثْلُ أُجُورِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ أُجُورِهِمْ شَيْئًا وَمَنْ دَعَا إِلَى ضَلاَلَةٍ كَانَ عَلَيْهِ مِنَ الإِثْمِ مِثْلُ آثَامِ مَنْ تَبِعَهُ لاَ يَنْقُصُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ آثَامِهِمْ شَيْئًا

He who calls (people) to righteousness, there would be reward (assured) for him like the rewards of those who adhered to it, without their rewards being diminished in any respect. And he who called (people) to error, he shall have to carry (the burden) of its sin, like those who committed it, without their sins being diminished in any respect.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2674 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi)

Footnote:

If you invite someone to a virtuous deed and they act upon it, you will receive a reward equal to theirs — without their reward being reduced in the slightest. Conversely, if you guide someone toward a sinful act, you will also share in that sin equally. This is a serious reminder for those of us who promote dramas, movies, or similar content on social media, or who influence friends to start smoking cigarettes, taking drugs, or engaging in other harmful habits. The chain of sin from such actions can continue even after our death.

Narrated Al-Bara bin `Azib, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me,

إِذَا أَتَيْتَ مَضْجَعَكَ فَتَوَضَّأْ وَضُوءَكَ لِلصَّلاَةِ ثُمَّ اضْطَجِعْ عَلَى شِقِّكَ الأَيْمَنِ وَقُلِ اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِي إِلَيْكَ وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِي إِلَيْكَ وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِي إِلَيْكَ رَهْبَةً وَرَغْبَةً إِلَيْكَ لاَ مَلْجَأَ ، وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلْتَ فَإِنْ مُتَّ مُتَّ عَلَى الْفِطْرَةِ فَاجْعَلْهُنَّ آخِرَ مَا تَقُولُ

When you go to bed to sleep, perform ablution (wudu) as you do for prayer (salat). Then lie down on your right side and recite this du'a (supplication),اللَّهُمَّ أَسْلَمْتُ نَفْسِيْ إِلَيْكَ وَفَوَّضْتُ أَمْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ وَأَلْجَأْتُ ظَهْرِيْ إِلَيْكَ رَهْبَةً وَرَغْبَةً إِلَيْكَ لاَ مَلْجَأَ وَلاَ مَنْجَا مِنْكَ إِلاَّ إِلَيْكَ آمَنْتُ بِكِتَابِكَ الَّذِي أَنْزَلْتَ وَبِنَبِيِّكَ الَّذِيْ أَرْسَلْتَ (O Allah, I have submitted my face (i.e., all of my faculties) to You, and I have entrusted all my affairs to You. I have turned my back (in dependence) towards You in hope of Your mercy and fear of Your punishment. There is no refuge and no escape from You except with You. I believe in the Book You have revealed and in the Prophet You have sent.) If you die during the night, you will die upon the natural religion of Islam. Therefore, let these words be the last thing you say before sleeping.

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 6311 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 5872 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated by Umar ibn al-Khattab (RA), he said, the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ تَوَضَّأَ فَأَحْسَنَ الوُضُوءَ ثُمَّ قَالَ : أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيكَ لَهُ ، وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُولُهُ ، اللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِي مِنَ التَّوَّابِينَ ، وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِينَ ، فُتِحَتْ لَهُ ثَمَانِيَةُ أَبْوَابِ الجَنَّةِ يَدْخُلُ مِنْ أَيِّهَا شَاءَ.

Whoever performs ablution (wudu) properly and then recites this supplication, the eight gates of Paradise will be opened for him, and he may enter through whichever one he wishes. The du'a is: -أَشْهَدُ أَنْ لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لاَ شَرِيْكَ لَهُ وَأَشْهَدُ أَنَّ مُحَمَّدًا عَبْدُهُ وَرَسُوْلُهُ اَللَّهُمَّ اجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ التَّوَّابِيْنَ وَاجْعَلْنِيْ مِنَ الْمُتَطَهِّرِيْنَ Meaning: I bear witness that there is no deity worthy of worship except Allah, alone, without any partner; and I bear witness that Muhammad is His servant and His messenger. O Allah, make me among those who constantly repent and make me among those who purify themselves.

Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi, Hadith 55 (authenticated by Ahmad Shakir)

Narrated Jabir bin `Abdullah, Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said,

مَنْ قَالَ حِينَ يَسْمَعُ النِّدَاءَ اللَّهُمَّ رَبَّ هَذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ آتِ مُحَمَّدًا الْوَسِيلَةَ وَالْفَضِيلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَامًا مَحْمُودًا الَّذِي وَعَدْتَهُ حَلَّتْ لَهُ شَفَاعَتِي يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ

Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said, "Whoever after listening to the Adhan says, :اَللّهُمَّ رَبَّ هذِهِ الدَّعْوَةِ التَّامَّةِ، وَالصَّلاَةِ الْقَائِمَةِ، آتِ مُحَمَّداً الْوَسِيْلَةَ وَالْفَضِيْلَةَ وَابْعَثْهُ مَقَاماً مَّحْمُوْداً الَّذِيْ وَعَدْتَّهُ‘ [O Allah! Lord of this perfect call (perfect by not ascribing partners to You) and of the regular prayer which is going to be established, give Muhammad the right of intercession and illustriousness, and resurrect him to the best and the highest place in Paradise that You promised him (of)], then my intercession for him will be allowed on the Day of Resurrection".

Sahih al-Bukhari, Hadith 614 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 587 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Nu'man b. Bashir reported Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) as saying,

الْمُسْلِمُونَ كَرَجُلٍ وَاحِدٍ إِنِ اشْتَكَى عَيْنُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ وَإِنِ اشْتَكَى رَأْسُهُ اشْتَكَى كُلُّهُ

The similitude of believers regarding mutual love, affection, and fellow-feeling is that of one body; when any limb of it aches, the whole body aches, because of sleeplessness and fever.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2586 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6353 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported that a person came to Allah, 's Messenger (ﷺ) and said,

قَالَ رَجُلٌ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ مَنْ أَحَقُّ بِحُسْنِ الصُّحْبَةِ قَالَ « أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أُمُّكَ ثُمَّ أَبُوكَ ثُمَّ أَدْنَاكَ أَدْنَاكَ »

“O Messenger of Allah! Who among the people is most deserving of my good treatment?” He (the Prophet ﷺ) replied, “Your mother.” The man asked again, “Then who?” He said, “Your mother.” He asked a third time, “Then who?” He said, “Your mother.” Then the man asked, “Then who?” The Prophet said, “Your father. Then (in order) your nearest relative, and then the next nearest.”

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2548 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi) 6270 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Abu Huraira reported Allah's Apostle (ﷺ) as saying,

« رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ثُمَّ رَغِمَ أَنْفُ ». قِيلَ مَنْ يَا رَسُولَ اللَّهِ قَالَ « مَنْ أَدْرَكَ أَبَوَيْهِ عِنْدَ الْكِبَرِ أَحَدَهُمَا أَوْ كِلَيْهِمَا فَلَمْ يَدْخُلِ الْجَنَّةَ »

Let him be humbled into dust; let him be humbled into dust. It was said: Allah's Messenger, who is he? He said: He who sees either of his parents during their old age, or he sees both of them, but he does not enter Paradise.

Sahih Muslim, Hadith 2551 (Verified by Fuad Abdul Baqi), 6279 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Narrated `Umar bin Abi Salama (RA),

كُنْتُ غُلاَمًا فِي حَجْرِ رَسُولِ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم وَكَانَتْ يَدِي تَطِيشُ فِي الصَّحْفَةِ فَقَال لِي رَسُولُ اللهِ صلى الله عليه وسلم يَا غُلاَمُ سَمِّ اللَّهَ وَكُلْ بِيَمِينِكَ وَكُلْ مِمَّا يَلِيكَ فَمَا زَالَتْ تِلْكَ طِعْمَتِي بَعْدُ.

I was a boy under the care of Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) and my hand used to go around the dish while I was eating. So Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) said to me, 'O boy! Mention the Name of Allah and eat with your right hand, and eat of the dish what is nearer to you." Since then, I have applied those instructions when eating.

Sahih Bukhari, Hadith 5376 (Verified by Fu’ād Abdul-Bāqī), 4984 (Islamic Foundation Bangladesh)

Hazrat Umar ibn Abu Salamah (RA) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said to me,

وَكُلْ بِيَمِينكَ، وكُلْ مِمَّا يَليكَ

Say Bismillah, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is in front of you.

Reference : Riyad as-Salihin 727, In-book reference : Book 2, Hadith 1

Narrated by Abdullah ibn Amr ibn al-As (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

قَدْ أَفْلَحَ مَنْ هُدِيَ إِلَى الإِسْلاَمِ وَرُزِقَ الْكَفَافَ وَقَنِعَ بِهِ ‏

Successful is the one who is guided to Islam, is provided with what is sufficient, and is content with it.

Muslim 1054, Tirmidhi 2348

Narrated Abdullah ibn Mas‘ud (RA): The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said:

لَا يَدْخُلُ الْجَنَّةَ مَنْ كَانَ فِي قَلْبِهِ مِثْقَالُ ذَرَّةٍ مِنْ كِبْرٍ

He who has in his heart the weight of a mustard seed of pride shall not enter Paradise.

— Jami‘ at-Tirmidhi 1922; Hasan Sahih
